scripts.say: Port - Royal Navy Dorms
One day, King George V asked me to prepare supper at the Royal Navy dorms — my biggest test yet since I started to learn how to cook for her sake.
So this supper is the culmination of the Commander's hard work? Let's give it a try.
Hood sized up my cooking, before bringing a bite to her mouth elegantly.
Not bad at all, Commander. I can taste the effort that you've put into this.
Hood, I must offer you my gratitude.
Oh? For what, may I ask?
This whole thing. Starting from the Commander's misconception, no... the fact that you recognized that I was overstepping my boundaries.
Heehee. I don't recall doing any such thing~
Although the Commander was the one who put in the effort, all of this is possible today because of the advice you gave.
This method of yours — getting to know each other better by sharing your soft side — really worked out well.
Yes, it's well suited for you.
Indeed, it wasn't only our relationship that improved. When word spread that I had been cooking for her, she seemed much more approachable and relatable in the eyes of the other factions.
Hahaha! I can't deny that!
While joking merrily with Hood, she turned her face towards me and smiled.
In any case, thank you as well for doing all of this for me, Commander.
There's a saying that "the quickest way to one's heart is through their stomach." In my case though, you've managed to win over both at once... Hahaha...
Oh my...
Ahh, um, sorry. I didn't mean to spring that upon you all of a sudden. I'll try to read the mood better next time...
I'm not as easygoing as Wales, nor am I as forceful as Duke of York.
But I'm not good at letting go of people who manage to earn my trust.
She may have grown quite a lot through our time together, but some things never change. Her straightforward and earnest confession was charismatic and irresistible.
I smiled at her, looking forward to the many culinary adventures that we would have together.
